title_detail.value: Trump’s first 100 days: all the news affecting the tech industry

entries.summary: President Donald Trump kicked off the first day of his presidency by signing a flurry of executive actions, including halting enforcement of the TikTok ban and rolling back the Biden administration’s artificial intelligence order. Having already run the country once before, Trump entered the presidency with the goal of hitting the ground running, having already […]

summary_detail.value: President Donald Trump kicked off the first day of his presidency by signing a flurry of executive actions, including halting enforcement of the TikTok ban and rolling back the Biden administration’s artificial intelligence order. Having already run the country once before, Trump entered the presidency with the goal of hitting the ground running, having already […]

content.value:
President Donald Trump kicked off the first day of his presidency by signing a flurry of executive actions, including halting enforcement of the TikTok ban and rolling back the Biden administration’s artificial intelligence order.

Having already run the country once before, Trump entered the presidency with the goal of hitting the ground running, having already selected nominees and chairs for key agencies that oversee tech. This time, Trump has the backing of many tech billionaires who attended his inauguration and showed up at his home in Mar-a-Lago.

Read on below as we keep track of all the ways Trump is leaving his mark on tech in his first 100 days in office.

entries.title: The iOS 18.4 beta brings Matter robot vacuum support

title_detail.value: The iOS 18.4 beta brings Matter robot vacuum support

entries.summary: Apple released the first developer beta of iOS 18.4 yesterday, which users have since discovered contains support for robot vacuums in the Apple Home app through Matter. As spotted by 9to5Mac, Smart Home Centre confirmed the functionality using a Switchbot S10, which offers its own beta support for Matter. (Switchbot first added Matter robot vacuum support last […]

summary_detail.value: Apple released the first developer beta of iOS 18.4 yesterday, which users have since discovered contains support for robot vacuums in the Apple Home app through Matter. As spotted by 9to5Mac, Smart Home Centre confirmed the functionality using a Switchbot S10, which offers its own beta support for Matter. (Switchbot first added Matter robot vacuum support last […]

content.value:
Apple released the first developer beta of iOS 18.4 yesterday, which users have since discovered contains support for robot vacuums in the Apple Home app through Matter.

As spotted by 9to5Mac, Smart Home Centre confirmed the functionality using a Switchbot S10, which offers its own beta support for Matter. (Switchbot first added Matter robot vacuum support last year, but it required a hub and was kind of a hack.) Apple Home screenshots shared in the story show the robot vacuum’s Home widget (complete with a little robot vacuum glyph) along with a control screen featuring a start / stop button, options for choosing between “Vacuum” and “Vacuum and Mop,” selections for operating modes like “Quiet” or “Deep Clean.” There’s also a “Send to Dock” option, although Smart Home Centre notes that this only paused the S10.

Robot vacuums in the new iOS beta can also be added to automations and scenes. You can see how all of it works in the outlet’s video below.

Apple was expected to add Matter support for robot vacuum cleaners last year, but that didn’t materialize. Few robot vacuum companies offer Matter support at the moment, and some of those are still waiting on a firmware update to enable it. Robot vacuum makers have confirmed to us that these models will support Matter:

  • Ecovacs X8 Pro Omni
  • Ecovacs Deebot X2 Combo
  • Switchbot S20
  • Switchbot S10
  • Switchbot K10 Pro Plus
  • Switchbot K10 Plus
  • Dreame X50 Ultra
  • Dreame X40 Ultra
  • Roborock Saros 10 and 10R
  • Roborock S8 MaxV Ultra
  • Roomba Combo 10

Some of the other changes users have spotted in the first developer beta for iOS 18.4 include the addition of an ambient music Control Center option, a new “sketch” style option in Image Playground, Apple Intelligence-powered Priority Notifications, and the ability to set a default translation app. More changes could be coming, as this is only the first beta for a release that had been expected to begin Siri’s big upgrade, a shift that may still be more than a month away.

entries.title: Apple gets into AI: all the news on iOS 18, macOS Sequoia, and more

title_detail.value: Apple gets into AI: all the news on iOS 18, macOS Sequoia, and more

The most discussed feature of iOS 18 is the Apple Intelligence suite. With the release of iOS 18.2 on […]

summary_detail.value: Apple has released iOS 18 — plus iPadOS 18, macOS Sequoia, watchOS 11, and other new updates — bringing several key updates to how the company’s devices operate and setting the stage for generative AI features. The most discussed feature of iOS 18 is the Apple Intelligence suite. With the release of iOS 18.2 on […]

content.value:
Apple has released iOS 18 — plus iPadOS 18, macOS Sequoia, watchOS 11, and other new updates — bringing several key updates to how the company’s devices operate and setting the stage for generative AI features.

The most discussed feature of iOS 18 is the Apple Intelligence suite. With the release of iOS 18.2 on December 11th, features that are available now include generating images in Image Playground, creating custom “Genmoji” emoji, and ChatGPT integration. Other features of Apple Intelligence, including writing tools such as the ability to rewrite your text in different styles, trickled out to customers starting in October.

There are major non-AI changes to consider too, like the ability to change your default apps or test your hearing with AirPods.

Meanwhille, iPadOS 18 now has a calculator app and can solve math equations in notes, watchOS is keeping an eye out for sleep apnea, and now your iPhone can even message Androids with RCS.

Read on for all the news about Apple’s latest set of operating system updates.

content.value:
There are so many people here that nobody can tell where the end of the line is. New people arrive, ask if thereâ€™s a line, shuffle into a blob of bodies idling and waiting for someone to give them instructions. The hallway is horribly warm â€” unclear if itâ€™s from the bodies or the heat â€” and itâ€™s a little smelly, which could just be me but I donâ€™t think it is. I estimate between 100 and 150 people are hanging around, waiting for 2:15PM to roll around, their anticipation building. This is not a club with a strict bouncer, though it feels like it. This is the Luigi Mangione hearing.

The hearing is a relatively minor pre-trial status update, but for the people most tapped in, there is a lot riding on it â€” the Luigi info-drip has been a bit dry lately. Court dates for the 26 year old accused of murdering UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson in December keep getting pushed back. Mangione, who is currently being held in federal custody in a Brooklyn jail, has not made a public appearance since before Christmas. (Mangione is accused of gunning down Thompson in December outside a Midtown Manhattan hotel, and has pleaded not guilty.) On TikTok, commenters regularly complain th …

Read the full story at The Verge.

entries.author: Allison Johnson
entries.title: The best smartphone you can buy for under $500

title_detail.value: The best smartphone you can buy for under $500

entries.summary: Some of us take a kind of “I eat to live” rather than an “I live to eat” approach to gadgets. They’re tools that help you get things done, not something you want to invest a lot of time or money in. If that’s you — and there’s no judgment here from a certifiable gadget […]

summary_detail.value: Some of us take a kind of “I eat to live” rather than an “I live to eat” approach to gadgets. They’re tools that help you get things done, not something you want to invest a lot of time or money in. If that’s you — and there’s no judgment here from a certifiable gadget […]

content.value:
Some of us take a kind of “I eat to live” rather than an “I live to eat” approach to gadgets. They’re tools that help you get things done, not something you want to invest a lot of time or money in. If that’s you — and there’s no judgment here from a certifiable gadget nerd — then you can probably think of more worthwhile ways to spend $1,000 than on a phone.

Budget phones to the rescue. These devices are roughly $500 or under, and they’re more capable than ever before. You won’t get all the bells and whistles, but you will save a little money to spend on, I don’t know, actual bells and whistles. It’s your world.

Strong software support

At least a couple of years of OS upgrades and, ideally, three years of security updates. There’s no point in buying even a cheap phone if you have to replace it after just a couple of years because it stopped getting security patches.

A good screen

Since you look at it roughly two thousand times a day, your phone’s screen is one place you shouldn’t compromise. An OLED has richer contrast and color than an LCD, and the big screens on today’s phones really need at least a 1080p resolution. Faster refresh rates like 90Hz and even 120Hz are becoming more common on budget phone screens, but for my money, a smooth-scrolling LCD doesn’t look as nice as an OLED with a standard refresh rate.

Serviceable storage space

If you plan to hang onto your phone for a while, you’ll want enough storage space to accommodate all the system files, photos, and videos you’ll accumulate over the years. Ideally you’ll get at least 128GB built in, but at a minimum I look for 64GB with the option to expand space via a MicroSD card. 

One good rear camera, not four mediocre ones

Upgrades like telephoto cameras and optical image stabilization are rare in the under-$500 class, but you can still expect good, basic performance in good lighting from any modern smartphone. Low light is trickier. Phones in this class should offer a night mode to help with non-moving subjects in very dim light. And there are no bonus points awarded for adding extra macro and depth cameras to pad out the rear camera array — those 2- and 5-megapixel sensors are pretty much useless. 

Many of our picks run about $400 or $500, but there are great options for $300 and under, too. You can find a bright, high-definition OLED screen or a battery that lasts for days. If you can hone in on the one or two features that are most important to you and you’re willing to compromise elsewhere, you can get a phone that suits your needs for half the price of a flagship.

In this article
  • The best iPhone under $500
  • The best Android phone under $500
  • The best budget phone that performs like a flagship
  • The phone under $400
  • Other budget phones we tested

What compromises can you expect from a budget phone? Some combination of the following: slower processors, less storage, and lousier cameras than flagship phones, almost across the board. Many have lower-resolution screens, and most lack official water-resistance ratings, wireless charging, and NFC chips for contactless payment.

The best iPhone under $500

Screen: 4.7-inch, 1334p LCD / Processor: A15 Bionic Cameras: 12-megapixel f/1.8 with OIS, 7-megapixel selfie / Charging: 20W wired, 7.5W wireless / Weather-resistance rating: IP67

If your budget has a strict $500 cap and you’re looking for a new iPhone, the choice is easy. The 2022 iPhone SE is the only new iPhone under $500 — that is, assuming you can even find it. Apple recently discontinued the third-gen SE and iPhone 14 with the introduction of the iPhone 16E, which starts at $599 with 128GB of storage. Apple’s latest “budget” iPhone is sort of like an iPhone SE successor that takes after the iPhone 14, with USB-C, a Face ID-enabled notch, and a 6.06-inch OLED display; it also has a customizable Action Button and supports Apple Intelligence thanks to Apple’s latest A18 chip.

All that being said, the last-gen iPhone SE remains the least expensive way to get into the iOS ecosystem. It’ll do the job, but I would strongly encourage anyone looking at the SE to consider whether it’s doable to spend a bit more on the iPhone 16E, which launches on February 28th (stay tuned for our full review).

The important thing to know about the SE is that it comes with a very small, very dated 4.7-inch screen. It’s the same size as the one on the iPhone 6, and it’s starting to feel cramped in an age when apps and web pages are designed for bigger screens. The SE’s big bezels make the device look dated, too, but the usability of a small screen will be a bigger factor over the years to come.

That’s one of the biggest knocks against the SE — and it’s an important one. But if you’re not worried about a cramped screen, then the SE has a lot of upsides and can still be found at third-party retailers. Its A15 processor is the same as the one in the iPhone 13 Pro Max, so performance is still zippy enough for most tasks.

There’s IP67 waterproofing and wireless charging — both uncommon in this price range — and even though it uses an older 12-megapixel camera, it takes very nice photos and high-quality video clips. The camera has no night mode, which is a curious omission — basically every other midrange phone offers some sort of low-light photo mode, and the phone’s processor is certainly up to the task. Apple gonna Apple.

Read my full iPhone SE (2022) review.

The best Android phone under $500

Screen: 6.1-inch, 1080p OLED, 120Hz / Processor: Tensor G3 Cameras: 64-megapixel f/1.89 with OIS, 13-megapixel ultrawide, 13-megapixel selfie / Battery: 4,492mAh / Charging: 18W wired, 7.5W wireless / Weather-resistance rating: IP67

Google offers some very good high-end phones in the Pixel 9, 9 Pro and 9 Pro XL, but it’s the company’s budget phone that makes the most sense. For $500, the Pixel 8A offers a whole lot of what makes its pricier siblings good, but at roughly half the cost.

It’s a modest update over the Pixel 7A, which you can still buy, but the 8A comes with one big upgrade over the previous generation: seven years of OS and security updates. If you’re the kind of person who likes to hang onto their device for a long time, that’s huge — especially in the budget category where other phones might only come with one or two platform upgrades.

The 8A is also Google’s first budget phone to come with a 120Hz display, so scrolling and animations look super smooth. You also get wireless charging and an IP67 rating for protection against water immersion. The camera system is reliable, but it’s the most obvious place where Google had to make some compromises to keep the price low. It’s a fine all-around camera, but stepping up to one of the latest Pixel models gets you improved low light performance, an updated ultrawide camera, and a whole lot of AI-powered features.

If you can hold out for a bit, it’s also worth flagging the heavily rumored Google Pixel 9A, which will reportedly arrive on March 26th. Android Headlines says the phone will start at $499 with 128GB of storage and ditch the camera bar entirely, allowing it to lie flat on a table. Previous rumors also point toward a 5,100mAh battery, a 6.3-inch screen with a 120Hz refresh rate, a Tensor G4 chip, and 8GB of RAM.

Read my full Google Pixel 8A review.

The best budget phone that performs like a flagship

Screen: 6.78-inch, 1264 x 2780 120Hz OLED / Processor: Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 Cameras: 50-megapixel f/1.8 with OIS, 8-megapixel ultrawide, 2-megapixel macro, 16-megapixel selfie / Battery: 5,500mAh / Charging: 80W wired / Weather-resistance rating: IP64

The last-gen OnePlus 12R is $500, but it could easily trick you into thinking it costs twice as much. It comes with a very big, very nice screen, with refresh rates that go up to 120Hz and all the way down to 1Hz, making for a smooth scrolling experience when you need it and savings on battery life when you don’t. It’s a feature rarely seen on a phone under $800.

The 12R is equipped with the Snapdragon 8 Gen 2 chipset, which is a generation behind 2024’s processor du jour, the 8 Gen 3 (the latter can be found on the $599.99 OnePlus 13R). But the 8 Gen 2 still whips — it’s hard to throw anything at this phone that it can’t handle. Less good: the 12R’s IP64 rating, which means it’s splash resistant but not fully water immersible, like the Pixel 8A.

Fast charging is kind of OnePlus’ trademark, and the 12R stays true to the brand with up to 80W fast wired charging in the US (it’s up to 100W in other regions). It’s nice if you want to charge your phone on a more compressed schedule, like during your morning routine rather than at night.

Personally, I’d rather have slower wired charging if it meant I could have a feature that’s not present on the 12R: wireless charging. That is, once again, something the Pixel 8A offers. But that’s the beauty of the 12R — it knows what it is and what it isn’t. And if a low-cost phone with a big, high-quality screen and excellent performance is what you’re after, then the 12R is it.

Read my full OnePlus 12R review.

The phone under $400

Screen: 6.6-inch, 1080p resolution, 120Hz OLED / Processor: Exynos 1380 Cameras: 50-megapixel f/1.8 with OIS, 8-megapixel ultrawide, 5-megapixel macro, 13-megapixel selfie / Battery: 5,000mAh / Charging: 25W wired / Weather-resistance rating: IP67

The Samsung Galaxy A35 5G comes with surprisingly strong specs for its $399 price. They’re the kind of features you won’t really spot from the outside, but they’re important, particularly its IP67 rating for dust and water resistance. Unlike virtually every other phone at this price, the A35 5G is built to withstand water immersion, so you don’t need to sweat it if your phone lands in a toilet bowl or puddle.

Here’s another unexciting spec: four years of OS updates and five years of security updates. That’s not the very best in the budget category — the Pixel 8A takes that honor with seven years of updates — but it’s much better than the two or three years we typically see in phones well under $500.

The camera is lackluster; it’s fine in bright light but struggles in dim and mixed indoor lighting. It doesn’t have the strongest processing performance you can find under $500, either, and the Samsung-made Exynos processor occasionally stutters when quickly bouncing between tasks. I was horrified — horrified! — when I accidentally texted my husband one of the automatically generated replies because it popped up at the last moment as I was trying to tap on something else. These things don’t happen when everything loads quickly.

But overall, it’s a compelling package — especially with a big, crowd-pleasing OLED display and strong battery performance. If you’re a light user and not fussy about camera quality, the A35 5G offers some upgrades that make a real difference in the long term.

Other budget phones we tested

The 2024 Motorola Moto G Power has all the makings of a good budget phone, including a lovely vegan leather exterior and wireless charging. But it’s loaded with bloatware of the worst kind, and that alone disqualifies it from our recommendations. Read our impressions.

We also tested the OnePlus Nord N300, which doesn’t make an appearance among our recommendations. The N300 is very affordable at $228 but cuts too many corners to include fast charging. The pricier 12R that snags our recommendation above offers much better overall performance. Read our review.

The Samsung Galaxy S24 FE is another perfectly capable phone that doesn’t quite earn a recommendation here. It’s a little outside the scope of this guide at $649 anyway, but you do get a telephoto lens and a nice, big screen for that price. Still, you’re better off saving a bunch and picking up the Pixel 8A or trying to score a trade-in promo for the new Galaxy S25. Read our review.

Finally, if you’re looking for something quite different, the Nothing Phone 2 is an option with its sleek appearance and flashy interface (literally, it flashes) — just know that it’s not fully compatible with Verizon’s network.

Update, February 22nd: Adjusted pricing and added a mention of the rumored Google Pixel 9A and Apple’s forthcoming iPhone 16E, which launches at the end of February.

content.value:
Iâ€™m hard-pressed to find another example of a tech company announcing something and then waiting over four years to actually ship it, but thatâ€™s exactly the situation weâ€™ve reached with Spotify and its long-delayed HiFi feature. The latest reports indicate itâ€™s finally coming in a matter of months as part of a Music Pro package that Spotify hopes will ensure the serviceâ€™s continued profitability.

But this has become quite the saga.

First introduced on February 22nd 2021, Spotify HiFi was to roll out later that year â€” or such was the original plan, anyway. In that story, I wrote â€œyour turn, Apple Music,â€ which is funny in retrospect since Apple Music managed to successfully deliver lossless and high-resolution audio just a few months later (and at no added cost for subscribers). Amazon stopped charging extra for lossless music at around the same time.

By all accounts, this aggressive approach from both companies totally derailed Spotify HiFi, which was always going to demand an upcharge over the serviceâ€™s regular Premium subscription. The company went radio silent on the feature, and Spotify spokespeople never provided any meaningful updates on its status.

T …

Read the full story at The Verge.

title_detail.value: AT&T will let you split your bill with people on your plan

The company says the program is available for “select postpaid wireless plans,” and that those using SplitPay can still get multi-line discounts. It sounds […]

summary_detail.value: AT&T has introduced SplitPay, a new payment option that lets those sharing a phone plan with others split their payment line-by-line, so no one person has to pay the entire bill. The company says the program is available for “select postpaid wireless plans,” and that those using SplitPay can still get multi-line discounts. It sounds […]

content.value:
AT&T has introduced SplitPay, a new payment option that lets those sharing a phone plan with others split their payment line-by-line, so no one person has to pay the entire bill. The company says the program is available for “select postpaid wireless plans,” and that those using SplitPay can still get multi-line discounts.

It sounds like a nice idea, especially if you’ve ever had the experience of bothering people you’re sharing a plan with for their part of a bill that you pay. As for what happens if not everyone pays up, AT&T says the account holder is still responsible for the bill, and late payments could still result in extra fees or suspended service. The company writes that it will text each payer a payment link and what they owe when a billing cycle begins, and says it will notify the primary payer about any outstanding payments prior to the bill’s due date.

To set up SplitPay, you can head to AT&T’s SplitPay page, select the account holder, and then pick the individual lines and devices, like smartwatches or tablets, you want to assign to each payer, according to a help page on the program.

entries.author: Chris Welch
entries.title: The best wireless earbuds to buy right now

title_detail.value: The best wireless earbuds to buy right now

entries.summary: It’s hard to buy a bad pair of wireless earbuds these days, and with constant discounts and deals wherever you look, now is as good of a time as any to splurge on the pair you’ve been eyeing. The market has come a long way since the early era of true wireless earbuds when we […]

summary_detail.value: It’s hard to buy a bad pair of wireless earbuds these days, and with constant discounts and deals wherever you look, now is as good of a time as any to splurge on the pair you’ve been eyeing. The market has come a long way since the early era of true wireless earbuds when we […]

content.value:
It’s hard to buy a bad pair of wireless earbuds these days, and with constant discounts and deals wherever you look, now is as good of a time as any to splurge on the pair you’ve been eyeing. The market has come a long way since the early era of true wireless earbuds when we had to deal with mediocre sound quality and unreliable performance, all for the sake of ditching cables. Things are much different now. After several product generations of learned lessons, companies like Sony, Apple, Samsung, and others are releasing their most impressive earbuds to date. 

You can get phenomenal noise cancellation and sound quality in the premium tier of earbuds if you’re willing to spend big. But those aren’t always the most important criteria for everyone: maybe you’re looking for the perfect fitness earbuds or for a set that works just as well for Zoom calls as for playing your favorite playlists and podcasts.

Comfort

No matter how they sound, what good are earbuds if you don’t enjoy wearing them? Ears come in all shapes and sizes, so the comfort factor is highly subjective. Most of our picks include several sizes of ear tips; usually they’re silicone, but some companies use foam (or both). Again, which you like better comes down to personal preference. Silicone tips are more common, but foam can expand to fill more of your ear for a better seal. The most important tip I can offer is to try different-sized tips in each ear: you might find that one of your ears needs something bigger or smaller than the other.

Good sound

Just like with comfort, we all have our own inclinations for what we want from sound quality. Some people are bass-heads who can’t live without a thumping low end. Personally, I care more about dynamics, clarity, and definition from the music I’m listening to. I want vocals to ring through naturally and instruments to be well separated in the sound stage. I look for earbuds that can bring out the subtle details in my favorite songs.

Active noise cancellation

What was once a luxury feature is now the status quo. Many of our top picks include active noise cancellation to help quiet the raucous outside world. Whether you’re trying to concentrate at the office or rest while traveling, noise cancellation can be a huge help. However, some people hate the “plugged up” feeling of earbuds and prefer open-style buds that help maintain full awareness of their surroundings.

Long battery life

Most earbuds these days can reach between five and six hours of continuous battery life with ANC enabled. Some models can exceed that (and over-ear headphones tend to last much longer on a charge), but the convenience of being able to just pop your earbuds back into their case for more juice makes the tradeoff easier to live with.

Water resistance

Even if you don’t intend to use your earbuds for fitness purposes, there’s always a chance of getting caught out in the rain while wearing them. At minimum, you should be looking for earbuds that offer IPX4 water resistance. This safeguards them from splashes of water (and sweat), so they should be cut out for the hazards of daily life.

Tech companies are increasingly making their earbuds work best with their own products through exclusive features and functionality, so that’s another thing to consider as you shop around. If you want a perk like head-tracking spatial audio, you’ll need to use AirPods with an iPhone, Samsung buds with a Samsung phone, and so on.

The best overall wireless earbuds

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 8 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IPX4 / Bluetooth codecs: LDAC, AAC, SBC / Multipoint: Yes / Works best with: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Foam (XS, S, M, L)

Just like their predecessors, Sony’s newer WF-1000XM5 earbuds have again topped our recommendations for the overall best noise-canceling earbuds. Thanks to their larger drivers, the audio quality is more detailed and dynamic than before while still retaining the warmth and clarity that made the 1000XM4 so enjoyable. Sony has also further improved its ANC and is nearing the same territory as Bose’s QC Earbuds II. These earbuds do a terrific job of eliminating background noise. Battery life can stretch to eight hours of continuous listening with noise cancellation turned on.

Some people found the WF-1000XM4 to be bulky and uncomfortable, so this time around, Sony has managed to shrink the XM5 by 25 percent. Like before, the company includes foam-style tips that expand in your ears to create an excellent seal — and now there’s a fourth (extra small) set of tips in the box.

On Android phones, the 1000XM5 support Sony’s LDAC codec for higher-quality music playback. And they’re capable of dynamic head tracking spatial audio through supported video apps like Netflix. But even if you’re not using LDAC (or have an iPhone), these are up there with the very best audio-focused premium earbuds like Sennheiser’s Momentum True Wireless 4 — with substantially better noise cancellation to boot. They’re also capable of multipoint Bluetooth, so you can pair with two devices at the same time.

It’s worth noting that there were many reports of battery issues with the 1000XM4 over time as those earbuds aged, but Sony claims to have rectified that problem with the new model by tweaking the charging algorithm.

Read my full WF-1000XM5 review.

The best budget earbuds under $100

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 5.5 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IP54 / Bluetooth codecs: LDAC, AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (S, M, L)

When looking at Nothing’s Ear (a) earbuds, it’s easy to focus all your attention on the catchy yellow color or their fun, super compact carrying case. But at their $99.99 price, the company’s entry-level earbuds provide a ton of features, including active noise cancellation, a low-latency mode for gaming, multipoint Bluetooth pairing, and a decent IP54 dust and water resistance rating. 

And the sound quality you get outperforms my usual expectations for this price point. They’re not quite on par with Nothing’s higher-end Ears, but you do get expressive, very enjoyable audio — and you can customize the EQ further in Nothing’s mobile app.

Read my full Nothing Ear (a) impressions.

The best noise-canceling earbuds

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 6 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IPX4 / Bluetooth codecs: AAC, SBC, aptX Adaptive / Multipoint: Yes / Works best with: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (S, M, L)

Bose’s QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds are the most powerful noise-canceling earbuds on the market. Of all our top picks, they do the best job at offering peace and quiet from the cacophony of daily life and putting you in a private bubble with your music playlists or favorite podcasts.

The QC Ultra Earbuds are extremely similar to 2022’s QC Earbuds II in terms of design, fit, and sound. Audio quality is rich and dynamic, delivering more bass thump than, say, Apple’s AirPods Pro. And by switching to a two-piece ear tip / stabilizer fitting process, Bose’s latest flagship buds should fit a wider range of ears more comfortably. The Ultra also introduce a new Immersive Audio mode, which is Bose’s take on spatial audio.

Read my full QuietComfort Ultra Earbuds review.

The best earbuds for sports and working out

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 8 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IPX4 / Bluetooth codecs: AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (XS, S, M, L, XL)

After a long wait, Beats finally introduced the Powerbeats Pro 2 in early 2025. They carry forward the signature ear hook design of past Powerbeats earbuds, but improve upon the original Powerbeats Pro in several key ways. Beats added active noise cancellation and a natural-sounding transparency mode to the Pro 2; the first-generation pair lacked both. The earbuds themselves are lighter, too, and the charging case is noticeably smaller.

The Powerbeats Pro 2 also feature heart rate monitoring thanks to built-in sensors on each earbud. You might already have a fitness tracker, chest strap, or smartwatch for this purpose, but if not, you can use these with compatible apps like Nike Run Club, Runna, Ladder, Slopes, Open, Peloton, and YaoYao.

The Powerbeats Pro 2 remain rated IPX4 for water resistance. While that’s not as robust as some other fitness-focused buds, it should be sufficient to survive sweat and outdoor runs in various conditions. The earbuds still offer easy-to-use physical buttons and a dedicated volume rocker, so it’s easy to control them in the middle of a workout.

If you’re an iPhone owner, the Powerbeats Pro 2 earbuds include Apple-only features like dynamic head tracking for spatial audio, auto device switching, Find My integration, and more. For Android users, Beats has an app that packs in a smaller subset of these functions. 

Read our full Powerbeats Pro 2 review.

The best earbuds for iPhone owners

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 6 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IPX4 / Bluetooth codecs: AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (XS, S, M, L)

For those invested in Apple’s ecosystem, the second-gen AirPods Pro bring an appealing mix of top-notch noise cancellation and refined sound compared to the original pair. As always, they also include numerous features (spatial audio, audio sharing, automatic syncing across iCloud devices, etc.) that make them an ideal companion to the company’s other devices. They’re also the only AirPods that come with different sizes of ear tips for a customizable fit — including an extra small option.

The AirPods Pro have a compact case that supports wireless charging. Setting them up is as simple as holding the open case near your iPhone. The earbuds are lightweight and fit snugly in most ears. Their force sensor pinch controls are easy to get down, and with the second-gen model, Apple added swipe-based volume controls. The AirPods Pro have traditionally ranked among the best wireless earbuds when it comes to voice call quality, and the second-gen earbuds don’t disappoint. Their ANC is improved over the original model and is now right up there with Sony, and their transparency mode has gained the ability to quickly damper sudden, loud noises that might happen around you.

Where the AirPods Pro stand out is with their Apple-only features like head tracking for spatial audio, automatic device switching, extensive Find My support, and so on. The charging case now features a built-in speaker and a U1 chip for pinpoint location tracking, and the latest AirPods Pro have better sound and noise canceling capabilities than the original model. Plus, they retain their deep integration with Apple’s hardware ecosystem.

In the fall of 2024, Apple also rolled out an impressive set of hearing health features for the second-gen AirPods Pro. They’re now able to serve as clinical-grade hearing aids for people with mild to moderate hearing loss and protect your hearing in loud environments; you can even take a hearing test to assess your own level of hearing loss.

Read my full AirPods Pro (second-gen) review.

The best earbuds for Samsung Galaxy phone owners

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 6 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IP57 / Bluetooth codecs: Samsung seamless, AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: Android, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (S, M, L)

Samsung’s Galaxy Buds 3 Pro ditch the company’s more discreet designs of the past for a stemmed style that’s similar to AirPods and any number of other wireless earbuds. Boring? Maybe, but thanks to that change, I’ve found them to be more comfortable and provide better stability than the Buds 2 Pro. The sound quality is even better than before — and it was already excellent. These are right up there with Sennheiser and Technics from an audio fidelity standpoint.

The Buds 3 Pro are also a standout performer when it comes to call quality. And my favorite thing about these earbuds are the hands-free voice commands that don’t require you to say any specific wake phrase beforehand. You can just say “volume up” and / or “next song,” and it happens.

But they’re not perfect: the Buds 3 Pro lack multipoint connectivity, so they can’t connect to two devices at the same time. Just like Apple, Samsung prefers to automatically hop between products within its own walled garden ecosystem. Some people might consider this a dealbreaker, but I’ve still enjoyed the earbuds plenty without it.

Read my full Galaxy Buds 3 Pro review.

The best earbuds for Google Pixel phone owners

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 8 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IP54 / Bluetooth codecs: AAC, SBC / Multipoint: Yes / Works best with: Android, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (XS, S, M, L)

With the Pixel Buds Pro 2, Google has addressed most of the downsides of the original pair. They’re far smaller and lighter than the chunky first-gen Pixel Buds Pro. And there’s a small nub on the buds to help lock them in place even during intensive activities like running or exercise.

Google’s active noise cancellation still isn’t on the same tier as Bose, but the transparency mode on the Buds Pro 2 is among the very best you’ll find. It offers a crisp, natural passthrough for the outside world when needed. Multipoint support is included, and Google’s latest earbuds eke out impressive battery life that surpasses most competitors.

Got a Pixel phone? With the Pixel Buds Pro 2, you can have lengthy conversations with Google’s Gemini AI while your phone stays in your pocket. Features like head-tracking spatial audio and Clear Calling are also exclusive to those within the Pixel ecosystem. If that’s you, the Pixel Buds Pro 2 are a big step up from the previous buds in a much smaller package.

Read my full Pixel Buds Pro 2 review.

The best earbuds if you own both Apple and Android devices

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 6 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IPX4 / Bluetooth codecs: AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (XS, S, M, L)

Beats’ Studio Buds Plus are an upgraded, better-performing revision of the Studio Buds released in 2021. This time, the company has made the noise cancellation more powerful while also improving the quality of the transparency mode and extending battery life. If you’re going for style points, it doesn’t get much cooler than the translucent color option. These earbuds are very tiny and rank up with the best in terms of overall comfort.

What’s interesting about the Studio Buds Plus is that they use a proprietary chip that allows them to support native software features on both iOS and Android. Plenty of earbuds offer companion apps on each platform, but in the case of the Beats, they work with both Apple’s Find My and Google’s Find My Device. You also get simple one-tap pairing no matter which operating system you’re using.

The drawback to this dual-ecosystem life is that Apple customers don’t get all the usual bells and whistles that come with AirPods or even the Beats Fit Pro; you lose out on audio sharing, head tracking spatial audio, and other tricks. Wireless charging and an ear detection sensor (for auto-pause when a bud is removed) are also MIA, which stings a bit considering the price.

Read my full Beats Studio Buds Plus review.

The best earbuds for sound quality

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 7.5 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IP54 / Bluetooth codecs: AptX Adaptive, AptX, AAC, SBC / Multipoint: Yes / Works best with: Android, iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (XS, S, M, L)

Sennheiser’s Momentum True Wireless earbuds have always sounded fantastic; that’s never been the issue. But previous models in the series have been tainted a bit by bugs, unsteady performance, and battery reliability problems. The fourth-gen pair finally gets that part right while continuing to offer tremendous, detailed sound quality that stands above nearly all competitors. They’re a joy to listen to. The active noise cancellation can’t compete with the likes of Apple, Sony, and Bose, but if you care more about lush, intricate sound, the MTW4 won’t disappoint in the slightest.

These earbuds come with optional wing tips to help keep them securely locked in your ears. That could prove helpful for running or when hitting the gym. Sennheiser allows for plenty of EQ customization using its mobile app, and the Momentum True Wireless 4 support a range of Bluetooth codecs, including AAC, SBC, AptX, and AptX Adaptive. Sennheiser has also promised that they’re LE Audio and Auracast-ready for when those features become more widespread.

Read my full Momentum True Wireless 4 review.

The best earbuds for voice calls on iPhone

Noise cancellation: Optional / Battery life: 5 hours / Water resistance: IP54 / Bluetooth codecs: AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: iOS, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: None

Apple’s AirPods 4 come in two different versions, with a higher-priced option that includes active noise cancellation and wireless charging. But sound quality is identical on both sets, and equally as important in this case is that the same can be said of voice call clarity.

On the AirPods 4, there’s a new “voice isolation” feature — enabled by default — that uses machine learning both on the earbuds and your iPhone to eliminate distracting background noise on your end so that you come through clearly to whoever you’re speaking with.

Overall call quality is excellent with the AirPods 4. And beyond that, compared to the third-gen model, you can expect upgraded audio quality (with richer bass), new ways of interacting with Siri through head movements, and yes… there’s a USB-C connector on the included charging case, as opposed to a Lighting port.

The AirPods still have a one-size-fits-most hard plastic form factor, so I recommend trying them before committing to a purchase. However, Apple says it used more than 50 million data points to further refine the contours and overall stability of its latest earbuds. So, if previous models worked well for you, these seem like a safe bet. The only question is whether you feel like spending a little more to gain ANC, a transparency mode, wireless charging, and a built-in speaker for Find My location tracking.

Read my full AirPods 4 review.

The best earbuds for voice calls on Android

Noise cancellation: Yes / Battery life: 6 hours (ANC on) / Water resistance: IP57 / Bluetooth codecs: Samsung seamless, AAC, SBC / Multipoint: No / Works best with: Android, Windows, macOS / Ear tips: Silicone (S, M, L)

Sony’s unconventional LinkBuds were our longtime pick for the clearest voice calls on Android, but we haven’t had the chance to review their successors. For now, the aforementioned Galaxy Buds 3 Pro are an easy-to-recommend choice. The built-in “voice pickup unit” detects the movement of your mouth to help isolate your voice from background noise and keep conversations clear.

The Buds 3 Pro have proven dependable for me during video chats on Google Meet, and people have been able to hear me without issue, even when I’m answering a quick call on the street.

Read my full Galaxy Buds 3 Pro review.

How we test earbuds

Whether you’re using earbuds to check out a newly-released album on Spotify, as motivation at the gym, or to tune out distractions around the office, it’s important that they deliver on the key metrics of sound quality, noise cancellation, voice call performance, and more. We spend many hours putting our picks through the paces. This includes quiet listening sessions that reveal their full detail, overall fidelity, and dynamics. We also take these buds out into the real world — on rush hour subway commutes, around busy cities, and in crowded cafes — to gauge their connection strength and determine how effectively they can quiet the world around you. We test them on video calls at work and by calling friends and family, who provide blunt feedback on how their mics sound. And importantly, with earbud makers often reserving certain software tricks for their own preferred ecosystem, we see how the earbuds fare when used across multiple platforms.

Photography by Chris Welch / The Verge except where specified

Update, February 22nd: Updated pricing and added the Powerbeats Pro 2 as our No. 1 pick for best fitness earbuds.

entries.title: Asus is making a ‘Fragrance Mouse,’ and it’s coming to the US

title_detail.value: Asus is making a ‘Fragrance Mouse,’ and it’s coming to the US

entries.summary: If you were paying attention to CES this year, you may have come across the Asus Adol 14 Air Fragrance Edition’s curious gimmick: a magnetically-attached oil diffuser in the lid that emits the aroma of essential oils once the laptop heats up. Asus has now announced details about a “Fragrance Mouse” to go with it. […]

summary_detail.value: If you were paying attention to CES this year, you may have come across the Asus Adol 14 Air Fragrance Edition’s curious gimmick: a magnetically-attached oil diffuser in the lid that emits the aroma of essential oils once the laptop heats up. Asus has now announced details about a “Fragrance Mouse” to go with it. […]

content.value:
If you were paying attention to CES this year, you may have come across the Asus Adol 14 Air Fragrance Edition’s curious gimmick: a magnetically-attached oil diffuser in the lid that emits the aroma of essential oils once the laptop heats up. Asus has now announced details about a “Fragrance Mouse” to go with it. Mentioned along with the company’s Copilot Plus PCs at CES 2025, it’s coming to the US “around late April, early May,” company spokesperson Anthony Spence told The Verge in an email.

The Fragrance Mouse has a light-duty mousing layout of two buttons and a scroll wheel. Its trick is on the underside, where a small compartment holds a refillable vial you can load with essential oils of your choosing. It’s an otherwise standard affair — the mouse connects wirelessly over Bluetooth or a 2.4GHz wireless USB dongle, offers adjustable DPI (1200dpi, 1600dpi, and 2400dpi), and is powered by a single AA battery. Asus says it’s “available in distinctive Iridescent White or Rose Clay finishes.”

You may not be able to get a complete stinky laptop and mouse set, since the Adol 14 Air Fragrance Edition has only been released in China since being introduced in July 2024, as Ars Technica notes. Spence was unable to confirm pricing details for the Fragrance Mouse in his email to The Verge.

Update February 22nd: Added that Asus had previously mentioned the Fragrance Mouse in January.

summary_detail.value: The fuzz of the cathode-ray tube (CRT) monitor, alongside static grains and flickering scanlines, is a touchstone for â€™90s-era nostalgia. Itâ€™s shorthand for those halcyon days when technology was predominantly analog and millennial kids spent their summers shoving bulky tapes into VHS players, recording favorite bits of their after-school television shows, and making their own […]

content.value:
The fuzz of the cathode-ray tube (CRT) monitor, alongside static grains and flickering scanlines, is a touchstone for â€™90s-era nostalgia. Itâ€™s shorthand for those halcyon days when technology was predominantly analog and millennial kids spent their summers shoving bulky tapes into VHS players, recording favorite bits of their after-school television shows, and making their own home videos with camcorders. Itâ€™s this vignette that developer Donâ€™t Nod MontrÃ©al leans heavily into in Lost Records: Bloom & Rage. The game follows a blossoming friendship â€” and apparent falling-out â€” of four teenagers over an unforgettable summer. And it all starts with a good dose of that nostalgia: the ubiquitously blue anti-drug message that precedes the title screen, complete with the telltale flicker of a CRT monitor.

Such adolescent longing is all par for the course for Donâ€™t Nod. Alongside Telltale, the studio popularized the choose-your-own-adventure style of narrative games with Life is Strange, while foregrounding the outsized pain and tribulations of teenhood. But more than just coating teenage drama in a layer of dreamy nostalgia, Bloom & Rage is also an opportunity for Donâ€™t …

Read the full story at The Verge.

title_detail.value: TV 2 Nyheder

entries.title: De omtales som "højreradikale" og "ekstreme", men hvad ved vi egentlig om AfD's immigrationspolitik

title_detail.value: De omtales som "højreradikale" og "ekstreme", men hvad ved vi egentlig om AfD's immigrationspolitik

entries.summary: Partiet har kontroversielle medlemmer og fører en politik, der i Tyskland anses som "højreekstrem", men alligevel agter hver femte at stemme på dem.

summary_detail.value: Partiet har kontroversielle medlemmer og fører en politik, der i Tyskland anses som "højreekstrem", men alligevel agter hver femte at stemme på dem.

content.value:
Partiets navn høres igen og igen, og dets holdninger har været et af de mest omdiskuterede emner i tysk politik den seneste tid.

Alternative für Deutschland – eller blot AfD – ser ud til at få sit stærkeste valg nogensinde.

I dag gør 59 millioner tyskere til valg, hvor de skal tage stilling til, om det i Tyskland kontroversielle parti skal vokse endnu mere i størrelse.

Partiet trådte ind i parlamentet for otte år siden med modstand mod migration som hovedtema, men har siden udnyttet utilfredshed med energipolitik, covid-19-restriktioner og støtten til Ukraine til at opnå momentum.

De seneste meningsmålinger viser, at partiet, der ofte internt i Tyskland bliver omtalt som højreradikalt, kan blive det andetstørste parti i Tyskland.

Men er det en fair beskrivelse af partiet, og er dets immigrationspolitik overhovedet så radikal, hvis man eksempelvis sammenligner med danske partier?

TV 2 har talt med en række Tysklands-kendere om netop det.

Visse lighedspunkter

Moritz Schramm, der er lektor ved Institut for Kultur og Sprogvidenskaber ved Syddansk Universitet, og som desuden er formand i Dansk-Tysk Selskab, anerkender, at der kan være sammenfald med danske partiers immigrationspolitik og den, som AfD har med i sit partiprogram.

- Deres (AfD's, red.) konkrete politik, særligt på immigrationsområdet, har nok nogle lighedspunkter med visse partier på den danske højrefløj – og for den sags skyld partier, som man ikke anser som værende en del af højrefløjen – men jeg mener ikke, at man på den måde kan sammenligne det, fortæller han til TV 2.

Den analyse er TV 2s korrespondent i Tyskland, Uffe Dreesen, enig i.

Det skyldes i høj grad landets historiske kontekst og forbindelsen til nazisterne, mener han.

- Jeg plejer at joke med, at man altså ikke kan sige, at AfD er Dansk Folkeparti i tyrolerbusker, fortæller han og fortsætter:

- Det er et parti i Tyskland, ikke i Danmark, og landet har historisk set et ansvar i forbindelse til Holocaust. Derfor er man i Tyskland meget opmærksomme på, om der er nogen (partier eller grupper, red), der kunne finde på at gøre noget lignende.

Undersøges af sikkerhedspolitiet

Uffe Dreesen forklarer, at de føderale myndigheder fortsat er i gang med at undersøge, om AfD kan betegnes som højreekstremt, hvilket vil være i strid med den tyske forfatning.

- Der er ikke nogen stemmeberettigede danske partier, der forsøger at omlægge det danske samfund på et fundamentalt plan, understreger han.

Derfor er AfD – også i skrivende stund – overvåget af det tyske sikkerhedspoliti (Verfassungsschutz).

Men i tre af de i alt 16 tyske delstater er partiet allerede erklæret som værende højreekstremt.

Det drejer sig om Thüringen, Sachsen og Sachsen-Anhalt.

- I de her delstater har man altså vurderet, at partiet rent faktisk forsøger at omstyrte samfundet, som tyskerne kender det, fortæller TV 2-korrespondenten.

Han påpeger desuden, at alle tre delstater er østtyske, og det er da også i den del af landet, at AfD særligt har vundet momentum de seneste år.

Kontroversielle medlemmer

Både Uffe Dreesen og Moritz Schramm mener desuden, at det særligt er den "fjendtlige retorik", der har givet AfD medvind i sejlene, mens de danske højrefløjspartier forsøger at gøre sig selv mere moderate for ikke at miste vælgeropbakning.

- AfD er rykket længere til højre, for det er de mest højtråbende og højreradikale, der i stigende grad har fået magt i partiet. Det mener jeg, de har fået, netop fordi de har været de mest radikale, siger Uffe Dreesen.

Han peger desuden på, at det netop er den fjendtlige – og i nogle tilfælde racistiske – retorik, der føres i partiet, som for alvor adskiller AfD fra eksempelvis den yderste danske højrefløj.

Han henviser blandt andet til Maximilian Krah og Björn Höcke.

Maximilian Krahs navn gik verden rundt, da han i et interview udtalte, at ikke alle SS-medlemmer "nødvendigvis" var kriminelle.

Björn Höcke blev i 2023 idømt 130 dagbøder på 130 euro for brug af "nazi-parole", da han ved et møde med cirka 350 gæster brugte det forbudte nazi-udtryk "Alles für Deutschland (alt for Tyskland, red.)".

Mere præcist blev han dømt for at at anvende "forfatningsstridige formuleringer skabt af en terrororganisation".

- Her kan man sige, at man har rettens ord for at kalde ham (Björn Höcke, red.) fascist, fortæller Uffe Dreesen.

Hvad betyder "reimmigration"?

En anden væsentlig pointe, der adskiller AfD's immigrationspolitik fra den, der bliver ført af visse partier i Danmark, er det omdiskuterede spørgsmål om "reimmigration".

Partiet har selv fremført det som en plan, der skal massedeportere immigranter ud af Tyskland – men om dette skal gælde ulovlige immigranter, flygtninge med opholdstilladelse eller endda tyske statsborgere med ikke-tysk baggrund, er uklart, siger både Uffe Dreesen og Moritz Schramm.

AfD har tidligere forsøgt at distancere sig selv fra begrebet, men i den seneste tid har partiets frontperson, Alice Weidel, taget det til sig, skriver BBC.

- I nogle af deres bøger skriver de, at det er op mod 25 millioner mennesker, der skal deporteres fra Tyskland, så det vil også inkludere tyske statsborgere. Der er også personer i partiet, der har sagt, at det også er folk, der er indvandrer-venlige, som skal sendes ud ad landet. Så det er meget ekstremt, fortæller Moritz Schramm.

Han understeger dog, at der også er mange personer i AfD, der ikke tilskriver sig disse holdninger.

- Jeg er sikker på, at mange i partiet mener, at spørgsmålet om reimmigration "kun" skal gælde flygtninge og ikke-tyske statsborgere, siger han og fortsætter:

- Så spørgsmålet er, hvor yderliggående de i virkeligheden er, og det kan man jo diskutere, men mange iagttagere – inklusiv jeg selv – tolker det som om, at de er mere yderligtgående, end de giver udtryk for.

En overset pointe

Ifølge Moritz Schramm skal man dog bide mærke i, at selvom 20 procent af de tyske vælgere står til at stemme på AfD, vil partiet på mange måder stå uden den store politiske indflydelse. Der er nemlig ikke nogen, der vil samarbejde med dem, mener han.

- Det er et strategisk element, som man ikke diskuterer så meget i Danmark. Partiet anses som værende så yderligtgående, at hvis andre partier forsøgte at samarbejde med dem, så ville de tabe massiv vælgeropbakning, fortæller han.

Han mener desuden, at selvom AfD står til at blive det andetstørste parti i Tyskland, så er det stadig et mindretal i Tyskland, der støtter partiet.

- Der er en splittelse i Tyskland. Men den går ikke ned over midten. Langt de fleste tyskere vil ikke have noget at gøre med AfD. De værdier, som AfD står for, har ikke flertal i den brede befolkning, afslutter han.

Hvis man skal tro de seneste meningsmålinger, er det Friedrich Merz fra CDU, der står til at blive Tysklands næste kansler, og selvom han har skærpet partiets retorik og politiske løfter, når det kommer til immigration, har han gentagende gange nægtet at samarbejde med AfD.

Men om Friedrich Merz vil overholde det løfte – hvis han altså vinder – kan kun tiden vise.

entries.title: Dansk parti kan få sensationelt valg, vurderer Tyskland-ekspert

title_detail.value: Dansk parti kan få sensationelt valg, vurderer Tyskland-ekspert

entries.summary: Mindretalspartiet kan få et fantastisk valg søndag, men succesen kan give bagslag.

summary_detail.value: Mindretalspartiet kan få et fantastisk valg søndag, men succesen kan give bagslag.

content.value:
Søndag kan det danske mindretalsparti SSW skrive historie. Igen.

Ved det seneste valg blev Stefan Seidler valgt ind i den tyske forbundsdag som den første SSW'er i et halvt århundrede.

Nu satser partiet på at få to mandater, så Mayliss Rossberg også bliver valgt ind. Det vil være sensationelt, siger historier og Tysklandsekspert Mirco Reimer-Elster, som selv er fra Sydslesvig.

- Det er ikke umuligt, men usandsynligt. Hvis jeg skulle sætte procenter på, ville jeg sige 10-15 procents sandsynlighed for, at SSW får to sæder i Forbundsdagen. Så det vil være en sensation. Men der er meget få meningsmålinger, der inkluderer SSW, så det er faktisk svært at sige, siger Mirco Reimer-Elster.

Danskerkongen klarer den

Partiets landssekretær, Martin Lorenzen, sagde i sidste uge til Flensborg Avis, at SSW's potentiale nok ligger et sted mellem fire og syv procent af stemmerne i Slesvig-Holsten. Det lyder meget sandsynligt, mener Mirco Reimer-Elster.

- Det ville være dumdristigt at sige, at den er hjemme for Stefan Seidler. Men jeg bliver både overrasket og chokeret, hvis "danskerkongen" ikke får fire år mere i Forbundsdagen, siger han.

Succes kan give bagslag

SSW bokser over sin vægtklasse ved ikke kun at tiltrække vælgere fra det danske mindretal.

- SSW fokuserer på mindretalsrettigheder, klimaforandring og grundlæggende at forbedre borgernes forhold i Slesvig-Holsten. Uanset om de tilhører det danske eller frisiske mindretal eller ej. De går ind for formueskat, at man reformerer gældsbremsen, gratis idræt og kultur til unge, at mindretallets rettigheder skrives ind i grundloven, og at mindstelønnen skal stige til 15 euro i timen, forklarer Mirco Reimer-Elster.

Det giver pote hos vælgerne. Men det kan faktisk give bagslag, hvis SSW bliver for populær.

- Det kan ikke udelukkes i fremtiden. Særligt hvis succesen fortsætter, og de regelmæssigt får over fem procent af stemmerne, der jo er den tyske spærregrænse, men som SSW som mindretalsparti er fritaget fra. I så fald genopstår diskussionen nok om, hvorvidt SSW er et mindretalsparti eller et regionalparti, siger Mirco Reimer-Elster.

entries.title: 24-årig dansker kan stjæle plads ved det tyske valg

title_detail.value: 24-årig dansker kan stjæle plads ved det tyske valg

entries.summary: I dag vælger Tyskland både en ny regering og afgør, om dansk-tyske Maylis Rossberg får en plads i Forbundsdagen i Berlin

summary_detail.value: I dag vælger Tyskland både en ny regering og afgør, om dansk-tyske Maylis Rossberg får en plads i Forbundsdagen i Berlin

content.value:
Når tyskerne i dag skal sætte deres kryds på stemmesedlen, står der to spidskandidater fra det sydslesvigske- og frisiske mindretal på listen. Nemlig Stefan Seidler og Maylis Rossberg.

Mens der er udsigt til, at Stefan Seidler får fire år mere i Forbundsdagen, er det endnu usikkert, om han får selskab af sin 24-årige partikollega.

- Det er en kæmpe ære, og det ville betyde meget for mig. Jeg vil gøre alt det, som jeg har lovet vælgerne: at arbejde for mindretallene og sørge for, at vi bliver hørt, siger hun.

Mere end en ung stemme

Maylis Rossberg trådte sine første skridt på den tyske ø Sild, der strækker sig op over grænsen mod den danske ø Rømø. Hun er også opvokset med en far, der var politisk aktiv i Sydslesvigs Vælgerforening.

Hun ved derfor alt om, hvor vigtigt det er, at det lille parti bliver repræsenteret i Forbundsdagen.

- Vi er det eneste parti, der kan være en stemme for mindretallene og mangfoldigheden. Så er vi også et regionalt parti, så vi er uafhængige og kan gøre en forskel ved at sætte vores emner på dagsordenen, siger den unge politiker.

Det er ikke kun på alderen, der gør, at hun skiller sig ud fra sin partikollega, Stefan Seidler.

- Ud over infrastruktur har jeg også fokus på mobiliteten, så den offentlige transport i Slesvig-Holsten bliver bedre, og alle har råd til at benytte sig af den. Det bidrager også til klimaet, som er vigtigt for mig, siger hun og fortsætter:

- Alderen gør selvfølgelig en forskel, men jeg har ikke kun fokus på de unges interesserer. Jeg vil gerne hjælpe alle uanset alder.

Berlin eller ej?

På søndag afgøres den unge kandidats politiske skæbne. Og valgresultatet kan ifølge hende gå mange veje.

- Det bliver spændende, for vi står over for et valg, hvor vi ikke kan forudse resultatet. Det er ikke til at vide, hvilken regering vi får på søndag, men jeg håber på, at det bliver en, der holder i fire år og som tager fat på udfordringerne i Tyskland.

Stefan Seidler ser frem til at samarbejdet med den 24-årige, hvis det lykkes at få endnu en plads i Berlin.

- Jeg ville glæde mig rigtig meget over at få en ung dynamisk kvinde med ind i Forbundsdagen. Og det er jo helt klart, at hun appellerer til en anden skare og et andet klientel, end jeg gør. På den måde kunne det være rigtig fint, og vi supplerer hinanden rigtig godt, siger han.

entries.title: Musk kræver redegørelse fra alle statsansatte om arbejdsindsats

title_detail.value: Musk kræver redegørelse fra alle statsansatte om arbejdsindsats

entries.summary: USA's statsansatte skal redegøre for arbejdet i foregående uge. Manglende svar ses som opsigelse, siger Musk.

summary_detail.value: USA's statsansatte skal redegøre for arbejdet i foregående uge. Manglende svar ses som opsigelse, siger Musk.

content.value:
Alle medarbejdere, der arbejder for eller i den amerikanske stat, skal forklare, hvilket arbejde de har udført i den foregående uge. Hvis de ikke gør det, vil det blive betragtet som en opsigelse.

Det skriver rigmanden Elon Musk, der står i spidsen for den amerikanske Trump-administrations effektiviseringsenhed, Doge, på det sociale medie X.

- I overensstemmelse med præsident Trumps instruktioner vil alle føderale medarbejdere snart modtage en e-mail, der anmoder om en forklaring på, hvad de lavede i sidste uge. Manglende svar vil blive betragtet som en opsigelse.

Fem punkter skal udfyldes

Ifølge CBS News har føderale medarbejdere allerede modtaget en e-mail, hvori der står: "Hvad lavede du i sidste uge?"

Medarbejderne skal udfylde fem punkter om, hvad de har udrettet i den forgangne uge, men uden at der fremgår fortrolige oplysninger.

E-mailen, der er sendt fra en HR-mailadresse, giver medarbejderne indtil klokken 23.59 på mandag lokal tid til at svare, skriver nyhedsbureauet Reuters.

USA's præsident, Donald Trump, skrev tidligere på dagen på sit eget sociale medie, Truth Social, at Musk gør et godt stykke arbejde med at reducere den føderale regerings størrelse, men at han ønsker, at Musk går mere aggressivt til værks.

En ulovlig opsigelse, siger fagforening

Det er uklart, hvilket juridisk grundlag Musk har til at opsige føderale medarbejdere, som ikke reagerer på hans anmodning.

Fagforeningen AFGE, der repræsenterer føderalt ansatte, udtaler i en erklæring, at den vil udfordre enhver "ulovlig opsigelse", skiver Reuters.

- Endnu en gang har Elon Musk og Trump-administrationen vist deres totale foragt for føderalt ansatte og de kritiske tjenester, som de leverer til det amerikanske folk, lød det fra AFGE's nationale præsident, Everett Kelly.

Trump-administrationens stræben efter at reducere offentlige udgifter har ifølge Reuters ført til vilkårlige fyringer af medarbejdere.

Dette har ført til, at der er blevet begået adskillige fejl, og flere agenturer har efterfølgende hurtigt genansat kernemedarbejdere som for eksempel dem, der arbejder med atomsikkerhed, forsvar og energiproduktion.

entries.title: Netanyahu udskyder løsladelse af over 600 palæstinensiske fanger

title_detail.value: Netanyahu udskyder løsladelse af over 600 palæstinensiske fanger

entries.summary: Israels premierministerkontor kræver, at Hamas stopper "ydmygende ceremonier" ved frigivelser af gidsler.

summary_detail.value: Israels premierministerkontor kræver, at Hamas stopper "ydmygende ceremonier" ved frigivelser af gidsler.

content.value:
Israels løsladelse af over 600 palæstinensiske fanger, der var ventet at finde sted lørdag, er blevet udskudt.

Det udtaler Israels premierministerkontor i en udtalelse natten til søndag, skriver nyhedsbureauet Reuters.

Ifølge nyhedsbureauet AFP lyder det videre, at løsladelsen af de palæstinensiske fanger først vil finde sted, når den militante bevægelse Hamas stopper med at afholde "ydmygende ceremonier" ved overdragelsen af gidsler.

- Det er blevet besluttet at udskyde løsladelsen af terrorister, som var planlagt i går (lørdag, red.), indtil løsladelsen af de næste gidsler er sikret uden de ydmygende ceremonier, lyder det ifølge AFP fra premierminister Benjamin Netanyahus kontor.

Israel mener, at der er tale om "vanærende ceremonier, som bringer skam over vores gidsler" og "kynisk brug af gidsler til propaganda".

Udskudt på ubestemt tid

Det israelske medie Times of Israel skriver på baggrund af udtalelsen, at frigivelsen af fanger er udskudt "på ubestemt tid".

Den første melding om udskydelsen af fangeoverdragelsen kom lørdag aften, hvor israelske kilder sagde til AFP, at den var blevet forsinket.

Her lød det fra en anonym embedsmand, at Netanyahu senere på aftenen ville holde et sikkerhedsmøde og træffe en beslutning om "de endelige skridt".

Lørdag blev seks israelske gidsler frigivet fra Gaza. I bytte var det ventet, at hundredvis af fanger skulle løslades fra israelske fængsler.

25 gidsler overdraget

Overdragelserne er led i en våbenhvileaftale, som trådte i kraft 19. januar, mellem Israel og Hamas.

I alt har Hamas overdraget 25 israelske gidsler, skriver AFP.

Ifølge AFP er frigivelserne sket under større ceremonier, hvor maskerede personer blandt andet har tvunget gidslerne til at vinke til indbyggere i Gaza, som er dukket op for at overvære begivenheden.

Herefter er de blevet overdraget til repræsentanter for organisationen Røde Kors, som så har overdraget dem til Israel.

Røde Kors har opfordret Hamas til at løslade gidsler i mere private rammer, hvilket bevægelsen har afvist.

Hamas har ikke umiddelbart kommenteret nattens melding fra premierministerkontoret.

entries.title: Trump og Trudeau drøfter Ukraine-krig og ulovlig fentanylhandel

title_detail.value: Trump og Trudeau drøfter Ukraine-krig og ulovlig fentanylhandel

entries.summary: Justin Trudeau og Donald Trump har talt i telefon om Ukraine-krigen og ulovlig handel med stoffet fentanyl.

summary_detail.value: Justin Trudeau og Donald Trump har talt i telefon om Ukraine-krigen og ulovlig handel med stoffet fentanyl.

content.value:
Den canadiske premierminister, Justin Trudeau, og den amerikanske præsident, Donald Trump, har lørdag talt i telefon sammen.

Det oplyser Trudeaus kontor i en udtalelse.

De har talt om krigen i Ukraine og om indsatsen mod den ulovlige handel med opioidet fentanyl.

Opkaldet finder sted, få dage før at de syv store industrilande i G7 ventes at deltage i et opkald med Natos generalsekretær, EU-chefer samt lederne af Rumænien og Polen for at diskutere krigen i Ukraine.

Det opkald skal efter planen finde sted mandag.

Ser frem til opkald

Det Hvide Hus oplyser, at både Trump og Trudeau har udtrykt ønsker om at afslutte den næsten tre år lange krig.

- Lederne sagde, at de begge ser frem til opkaldet på mandag, lyder det i udtalelsen.

Mandag er det tre år siden, at Rusland invaderede Ukraine.

Efter sin indsættelse i januar underskrev Trump et dekret, som indførte en told på 25 procent på varer fra Canada.

Præsidenten har blandt andet forsvaret handlingen med, at Canada, der støder op til USA's nordlige grænse, bidrager til både til en sundhedskrise og en migrantkrise i USA.

- Den ekstraordinære trussel, som udgøres af udlændinge og stoffer - herunder det dødelige fentanyl - udgør en national krise, har Det Hvide Hus udtalt.

Udsættelse af lov

Trump har underskrevet et dekret om samme straftold mod Mexico, der grænser op til USA mod syd.

Det var ventet, at straftoldene ville træde i kraft 4. februar.

Det er dog lykkedes begge lande at forhandle sig frem til en 30 dages udsættelse ved begge at love at indsætte 10.000 nye vagter på grænserne.

Der eksisterer egentlig en handelsaftale mellem USA, Canada og Mexico - den såkaldte Nafta-aftale - der har til formål netop at forhindre, at de tre nabolande eksempelvis indfører told på varer fra hinanden.

Trump-administrationen kommer dog uden om aftalen ved at omtale situationen som en "national krise", har det canadiske medie CBC skrevet.

Trump har også truet med at lægge told på varer fra EU.

entries.title: Storbritannien løfter mandag sløret for sanktionspakke mod Rusland

title_detail.value: Storbritannien løfter mandag sløret for sanktionspakke mod Rusland

entries.summary: Mandag vil britisk minister præsentere "største pakke af sanktioner mod Rusland" siden krigens begyndelse.

summary_detail.value: Mandag vil britisk minister præsentere "største pakke af sanktioner mod Rusland" siden krigens begyndelse.

content.value:
Storbritannien vil mandag løfte sløret for en større sanktionspakke mod Rusland.

Det oplyser udenrigsminister David Lammy i en udtalelse.

Mandag er treårsdagen for krigen i Ukraine.

- Dette er også tiden til at stramme skruen på Putins (Ruslands præsident, Vladimir Putin, red.) Rusland, lyder det i udtalelsen.

- Jeg har planer om i morgen (mandag, red.) at offentliggøre den største pakke af sanktioner mod Rusland siden begyndelsen af krigen, siger udenrigsministeren.

Et kritisk øjeblik

Den britiske beslutning om at skrue op for sanktionerne kommer, efter at USA's præsident, Donald Trump, i de seneste uger har forsøgt at holde Ukraine og de europæiske lande, som støtter Ukraine, ude af drøftelser om krigen med Rusland.

- Dette er et kritisk øjeblik i Ukraines historie, Storbritanniens historie og for hele Europa. Det er tid til, at Europa lægger sig i selen ("double down", red.) i vores støtte til Ukraine.

Det står endnu ikke klart, hvad sanktionspakken vil omfatte. Den britiske regering har allerede indført sanktioner mod 1900 personer og organisationer med forbindelse til Putins regering.

Sanktionerne er rettet mod blandt andet finans-, militær-, energi- og luftfartssektoren. Blandt sanktionerne er indefrysning af bankaktiver, rejseforbud og handelsrestriktioner.

Stensikker støtte

Onsdag godkendte EU sin 16. sanktionspakke mod Rusland. Pakken betyder blandt andet, at EU udfører flere tiltag i indsatsen mod den russiske skyggeflåde. Der indføres desuden et forbud mod import af russisk aluminium.

I udtalelsen understreger Lammy også den militære støtte til Ukraine.

Den indebærer et løfte om at sende tre milliarder pund, 27 milliarder kroner, til Ukraine årligt og at "være klar og villig til at stille britiske styrker til rådighed som del af fredsbevarende styrker om nødvendigt".

Ifølge BBC talte Storbritanniens premierminister, Keir Starmer, lørdag i telefon med Ukraines præsident, Volodymyr Zelenskyj.

Her gentog Starmer et budskab om "stensikker støtte" til Ukraine.

Starmer skal torsdag mødes med Trump i Washington D.C.

Her håber han ifølge AFP på at kunne bygge en "bro" mellem USA og Europa for at sikre Ukraine garantier i forhold til territorium og sikkerhed, i tilfælde af at der lander en aftale om en afslutning på krigen.

entries.title: Kendte USA-astronauter stempler ind i Andreas Mogensens skænderi med Elon Musk

title_detail.value: Kendte USA-astronauter stempler ind i Andreas Mogensens skænderi med Elon Musk

entries.summary: Den højt dekorerede veteran Mark Kelly opfordrer nu Musk til selv at tage plads i et rumfartøj frem for at bruge det som politisk projekt.

summary_detail.value: Den højt dekorerede veteran Mark Kelly opfordrer nu Musk til selv at tage plads i et rumfartøj frem for at bruge det som politisk projekt.

content.value:
Andreas Mogensens fejde med Elon Musk har sendt kolleger til tasterne med støtte til den danske astronaut.

Det sker efter et døgn, hvor Andreas Mogensen både er blevet kaldt "komplet åndssvag" og "idiot" af SpaceX-ejeren og tech-milliardæren, der nu spiller en betydende rolle i præsident Donald Trumps inderkreds.

Uenigheden er opstået på baggrund af et interview på Fox News med Elon Musk og den amerikanske præsident, Donald Trump.

Her kommer snakken ind på de to astronauter Butch Wilmore og Suni Williams, der fortsat er på Den Internationale Rumstation (ISS), selvom de skulle have været tilbage på Jorden efter ottes dages mission tilbage i juni.

Musk lyver, siger Mogensen

Musk hævder, med vanlig sans for ravage, at det er "politiske årsager", som har ført til astronauternes forlængede ophold på ISS-rumstationen.

Og det har Andreas Mogensen på X slet og ret kaldt "en løgn".

- Og så fra en, der klager over manglen på ærlighed fra mainstreammedierne, skriver den danske astronaut.

Men selvom Elon Musk er en magtfuld aktør, har der været solid opbakning at hente til den første dansker i rummet.

Mest prominent er måske Mark Kelly, der selv har en fortid som astronaut og nu er demokratisk senator fra Arizona.

- Hey, Elon Musk, når du får mod til det, hvorfor kravler du så ikke ind i et rumskib og får en snak med os alle tre, skriver Kelly på X.

Når Marc Kelly nævner en tredje person, er det med henvisning til sin lillebror Scott Kelly, der i 2015 arbejdede sammen med Andreas Mogensen i ti dage på den Internationale rumstation ISS.

Urimelig retorik

Også Scott Kelly har kategorisk taget Andreas Mogensen i forsvar over for Elon Musk.

- Denne retorik er urimelig, men desværre ikke overraskende. Han fortjener ikke denne form for respektløshed, siger Scott Kelly, der i dag er tilknyttet NASA i rollen som forsker qua sin erfaring fra fire ture i rummet.

Han skriver videre, at danskeren er "en af de mest kompetente, pålidelige og hæderlige mennesker, jeg nogensinde har mødt".

Baggrunden for de ophedede opslag er, at der ifølge Musk er en politisk årsag til, at to astronauter fortsat befinder sig på den internationale rumstation. Hvilket efter Andreas Mogensens opfattelse er forkert.

Ikke overraskende har Elon Musk taget til genmæle i retorisk infight med de to astronaut-brødre på det sociale medie X, han i dag også er ejer af.

- Han (Mogensen, red.) er en idiot, der offentligt angreb mig, på trods af at han ikke havde nogen idé om, hvad der FAKTISK skete. I øvrigt hævder din bror at være uafhængig, men er bare en demokratisk platugle, lyder bandbullen fra Musk.

Medbragte chokolade i rummet

Andreas Mogensen havde en særlig gave med, da han dukkede op på rumstationen ISS i september 2015.

Danskeren medbragte dessertchokolader med digte fra familiemedlemmer til alle ombord.

På det tidspunkt havde Scott Kelly og kollegerne svævet vægtløst i et halvt år, og den amerikanske astronaut fremhævede i en bog om missionen den smukke gestus fra Andreas Mogensens side.

Det er utvivlsomt episoder som ovenstående, der har medvirket til at give Andreas Mogensen masser af credit. Også i en disput med Elon Musk.

Har en høj stjerne

Ifølge astrofysiker og museumsinspektør Ole Eggers Bjælde har Andreas Mogensen en høj stjerne.

- Andreas Mogensen er en dygtig ambassadør både for Danmark og for hele astronomiverdenen, og der er vægt bag ordene, når han siger noget, siger Ole Eggers Bjælde til TV 2.

Han peger på, at Elon Musk også har et politisk sigte med sin hvasse kritik af NASA og den aktuelle rummission.

- Musk har en anden dagsorden. Han vil til Mars for enhver pris, og han har også sagt, at man skal fremskynde en beslutning om at tage den Internationale Rumstation ISS ud af drift for netop at lægge mere fokus på Mars, siger Ole Eggers Bjælde.

Efter planen skal Butch Wilmore og Suni Williams være tilbage på Jorden i marts.

entries.title: - Det er selvfølgelig helt uacceptabelt, siger forsvarsadvokat om nye henvendelser

title_detail.value: - Det er selvfølgelig helt uacceptabelt, siger forsvarsadvokat om nye henvendelser

entries.summary: En sag om stalking har udløst stor opmærksomhed, som for den forurettede har været meget voldsom, oplyser bistandsadvokaten.

summary_detail.value: En sag om stalking har udløst stor opmærksomhed, som for den forurettede har været meget voldsom, oplyser bistandsadvokaten.

content.value:
Det er "helt urimeligt", at den forurettede i sagen, hvor Sisse Sejr-Nørgaard er sigtet for stalking, har modtaget et væld af henvendelser på nettet.

Sådan lyder det fra Mette Grith Stage, der har været forsvarsadvokat i 20 år.

- Det er selvfølgelig helt uacceptabelt, at folk kontakter forurettede og klandrer personen, siger Mette Grith Stage til TV 2.

Fredag udtalte den forurettedes bistandsadvokat Miriam Michaelsen til Ritzau, at hendes klient oplevede "krænkende henvendelser", efter at Sisse Sejr-Nørgaard skrev om sagen i et opslag på Instagram.

- Vi holder øje med, hvad der bliver skrevet og delt. Vi bevissikrer det. Vi indrapporterer det til de platforme, det bliver delt på, og så kommer vi til at tage stilling til, om der er noget af det, der skal anmeldes til politiet, eller hvordan det skal håndteres, udtalte hun fredag.

Sigtet for stalking og identitetsmisbrug

Sisse Sejr-Nørgaard, der både er tv- og radiovært, har ifølge anklagemyndighedens sigtelse krænket sit offer ved at indtaste den forurettedes personoplysninger i 81 formularer gennem mere end en måned i løbet af sommeren 2024.

Den forurettede fik derfor tilsendt nyhedsbreve, bookingbekræftelser, telefonopringninger og beskeder.

Sisse Sejr-Nørgaard er derfor sigtet for stalking og identitetsmisbrug, og mandag aften bekræftede tv- og radioværten selv, at det var hende, der var sigtet, i et opslag på Instagram.

Men i opslaget blev der delt "oplysninger og detaljer", der siden har medført, at den forurettede er blevet kontaktet, mente bistandsadvokat Miriam Michaelsen.

- Så bliver konsekvenserne ofte, at dem, der læser det, føler sig berettigede til at undersøge, hvem forurettede er, og også endda skrive injurierende, krænkende og hadefuldt til og om forurettede, udtalte hun fredag.

Ifølge bistandsadvokaten har den forurettede oplevet den store opmærksomhed som værende meget voldsom.

Men selvom opmærksomheden er heftig, er henvendelsen som udgangspunkt ikke ulovlig. Det forklarer Sten Schaumburg-Müller, der er juraprofessor på Syddansk Universitet.

Svær situation med kendt person

Sten Schaumburg-Müller oplyser i et skriftligt svar til TV 2, at udgangspunktet er, at man gerne må rette henvendelse til andre.

Men der, hvor der kan være problemer, er, hvis henvendelsen er truende eller chikanerende ud fra et strafbart synspunkt. Der kan måske også forekomme strafbare ærekrænkende udtalelser, skriver juraprofessoren.

Der er hverken et navneforbud eller identifikationsforbud i sagen, og derfor er Sisse Sejr-Nørgaards opslag heller ikke strafbart, hvis det er grunden til, at flere har fundet frem til den forurettedes identitet.

Forsvarsadvokat Mette Grith Stage havde hverken tænkt på navneforbud eller identifikationsforbud, hvis hun havde været bistandsadvokat på sagen.

- Det her er en lidt speciel situation. Jeg havde ikke gjort det anderledes, forklarer hun.

Når en sag handler om kendte eller semikendte personer, er det bare svært at holde skjult, hvem det er, på grund af sociale medier, tilføjer Mette Grith Stage, der ikke selv er involveret i den pågældende sag.

Undrer sig over opbakning

En af dem, der har bidt mærke i Sisse Sejr-Nørgaards opslag på Instagram, er erhvervskvinden Anna Thygesen.
